Companies are embedded in a dynamic network of support agencies, the Naval Service, investors, world class test bed facilities and research excellence.

The GEC is an entrepreneurial community unmatched anywhere else in Ireland. We are a community of entrepreneurs, working in a dynamic environment specifically geared towards supporting ambitious, growth orientated companies. 
 
As well as the founders and employees of over 150 companies, you will find investors, mentors, business advisors and influencers, industry representatives and government support agents walking the corridors of the GEC. 
 
We also have large, bright contemporary office space along with access to accelerator programmes, professional networking events, social activities and training courses.
 
Contact us today for a tour! (info@gec.ie)

NovaUCD, the Centre for New Ventures and Entrepreneurs, has the hub of commercialisation and start-up activity at University College Dublin since 2003.

Over 35 high-tech and knowledge-intensive companies are currently located at NovaUCD.

In 2013 we produced a report to coincide witht he 10th anniversary of the opening of NovaUCD, which highlights the the impact of NovaUCD.

places.description:
South East BIC, a public private partnership, supports the generation and development of new innovative enterprises and assists existing SMEs to innovate and expand.
We provide high quality specialised business consultancy and active incubation. The BIC team works closely in collaboration with other local, regional, national enterprise support agencies and has strong international connections, particularly in Europe, through its membership of the European BIC Network (EBN).
From its Waterford base, the team works throughout the counties of Waterford, Wexford, Carlow, Kilkenny and Tipperary and focuses largely on project evaluation and development, business modelling, planning and sourcing finance.

4 Custom House Quay, Dublin, Irland
places.description:
Journey Re is a unique international Entrepreneurship Competition with the aim to create new, innovative business models in the re/insurance market. The competition is aimed at young professionals, graduates and students who are interested in finding “the next big thing” for re/insurance. 
What is the set up? Young entrepreneurial thinkers, selected globally, will be invited to attend an introduction week in Hannover (Germany) from 4 - 8 July 2016. During this week the selected participants will get reinsurance insights and learn innovation methods around design thinking and customer centricity. After this week, participants will have the unique chance to work for 6 months in a team of 3 people in one of the following locations:
 Berlin, Boston, Dublin and Johannesburg. 
The Kick-Off Event will take place on 21 April in the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin. Register for the Event as well as the Assessment at www.journey-re.com/registration.

places.addressDisplay: Michael Fitzpatrick Enterprise Centre, Station Road, Allenwood, Co Kildare
places.description:
Allenwood Community Development Association was formed in 1994, following the closure of the Bord Na Mona ESB Generation Station. The company has undergone significant changes during the period 1994 to 2011. The second  phase in the development  by ACDA involved the building of a further two Enterprise Buildings to make available over 23,000 sq ft of workshop and office space that has been fully let to emerging business over a period of three years. 
The Enterprise Park is the full time workplace for 67 people working both with ACDAL and with the 16 businesses that are now located within the Park, a further 10 people find regular part time work. 
Training for return to work opportunity is an important element in ACDAL’s activities and each day up to 50 people are engaged in training run by ACDAL, Leader Partnership and North West Kildare in association with FAS.
Innovatio and Job Creation are important aspects of the company and we provide Co Working(Hot Desk) and Low Cost Incubator Units, taargetted towards new companies. There isa Childcare Centre located within the complex. There is ample parking.

After this week, participants will have the unique chance to work for 6 months in a team of 3 people in one of the following locations:
 Berlin, Boston, Dublin and Johannesburg. 
The Kick-Off Event will take place on 21 April in the Guinness Storehouse in Dublin. Register for the Event as well as the Assessment at www.journey-re.com/registration.

The GEC is an entrepreneurial community unmatched anywhere else in Ireland. We are a community of entrepreneurs, working in a dynamic environment specifically geared towards supporting ambitious, growth orientated companies. 
 
As well as the founders and employees of over 150 companies, you will find investors, mentors, business advisors and influencers, industry representatives and government support agents walking the corridors of the GEC. 
 
We also have large, bright contemporary office space along with access to accelerator programmes, professional networking events, social activities and training courses.
 
Contact us today for a tour! (info@gec.ie)

places.description:
South East BIC, a public private partnership, supports the generation and development of new innovative enterprises and assists existing SMEs to innovate and expand.
We provide high quality specialised business consultancy and active incubation. The BIC team works closely in collaboration with other local, regional, national enterprise support agencies and has strong international connections, particularly in Europe, through its membership of the European BIC Network (EBN).
From its Waterford base, the team works throughout the counties of Waterford, Wexford, Carlow, Kilkenny and Tipperary and focuses largely on project evaluation and development, business modelling, planning and sourcing finance.

places.description: WestBIC is your support partner to drive and deliver high quality start ups. StartPlanet NI is an initiative designed to help high potential start-ups access early stage support and investment in Northern Ireland.

Invest Northern Ireland has contributed £2.6million to establish the seed accelerator which will focus on attracting both international and indigenous businesses with technology based ideas in the Knowledge Economy sectors.

The programme will make approximately £2 million of private sector equity investment funding available for selected startups (50 in total) over the length of the five year programme. 

StartPlanet NI is backed by an expert team with an internationally credible pedigree. Led by startup stalwart, mentor and founder Bill Liao, SOSventures European Venture Partner (also co-founder of CoderDojo and founder of WeForest.org), he is joined by Wayne Murphy Accelerator Manager, and Belfast based Diane Roberts from Xcell Partners running the programme.

In addition there is an impressive team of expert mentors with a wide range of international experience, who will offer invaluable and intensive mentoring and coaching to programme participants. 
 
The accelerator also offers an innovative co-operative approach to the investment that the startups will gain and the equity they offer in return. 

It will kick off in November 2015 with the programme’s first cohort of 10 teams. Each team will consist of 2-4 people who will have a product or idea almost ready for market. 
Participants will receive £15k ($23K USD / €21K EURO) seed funding and in return will be expected to part with 8% equity investment. 

Uniquely however, of that 8%, 2% will go towards a Founders’ Fund, which plans to generate shares in a pool made up of each company participating in the five year programme. The goal being that, if in the not too distant future, one or more of the startups has a significant exit - all those in the ‘pool’ will benefit.

places.description: CorkBIC manages the  Halo Business Angel Network (HBAN) in the Midwest and Southwest region of Ireland. HBAN is a joint initiative between Enterprise Ireland, InterTrade Ireland and the Irish Business Innovation Centres (BICs). Since inception, in 2007, the BAP has continued to grow, closing 169 deals, raising over €78.7million* in investment for Entrepreneurs across all sectors with a rapidly increasing component of cross border and international business angel seed capital investment. Of this €30.2m was sourced from private equity business angels registered with the Irish BICs. The deal sizes ranged from €30k to €1.2m and the average angel investment was €182k per deal. In 2014 the Irish BICs completed 30 deals raising over €17m seed capital equity investment in Irish Start-ups with CorkBIC assisting 11 companies to raise over €7.1million investment.(*Jan 2007 – Dec 2014)

Established in 2001, Genzyme Waterford, A Sanofi Company is situated on a 37-acre site in Waterford, Ireland’s oldest city. This multi-phased biopharmaceutical facility has seen capital investment of over €500 million and employs more than 550 personnel. 
It is a state-of-the-art facility that continues to grow in serving patients across more than 70 countries. Additional products continue to be developed and introduced to the site with the current expansion set to bring the first Sanofi insulin products to the facility.
Since Sanofi’s acquisition of Genzyme in 2011, the Waterford site has become ever more closely aligned with the Sanofi network in Europe and this continues to present fresh growth and development opportunities for our team and for the site.

Chambers Ireland, the umbrella group for the affiliated Chambers, works closely with Chambers to represent them and their members on a national level. Chambers work to promote the economic and social development of their community in order to make it a better place in which to live, work and do business. By being a member of a local Chamber, businesses have the service and supports that will help their business strengthen and grow in their community and beyond.

Shannon Chamber has been in existence since 1995, when a number of key business leaders decided their needs were not represented at regional / national level. We became affiliated to Chambers Ireland – the National Chamber movement – in 2003, and are now recognised as one of the most progressive and fastest growing chambers in the country.  With a current membership of over 270 companies, Shannon Chamber has an extended reach to approximately 10,000 employees.

Our membership levels have grown under the guidance of a dedicated and committed board of directors, representative of the business community. Members are not just drawn from the immediate Shannon vicinity but from the wider region including Bunratty, Kilmurry, Kilkishen, Meelick, Newmarket-on-Fergus, Sixmilebridge, Clarecastle, Limerick and Ennis and also from companies located outside the region, particularly in Dublin. All of our members benefit from networking, collaboration and exchange of ideas on issues of common concern.

places.description:
Galway Chamber is the leading business representative organisation in Galway. We represent the interests of all businesses and uniquely all sectors. We are a membership organisation made up of a cross range of businesses large and smaller. 

Our mission is to
Make Galway the leading location for business, investment, innovation and people. 

Together we can achieve this. 

Services and Expertise
We offer our members…

•	A strong and united voice

•	Lobbying and influencing on behalf of your business

•	Positive engagement through collective and coordinated dialogue with City & County Council Management, Councillors, TD’s, Ministers and State Agencies 

•	Opportunities to promote your business by reaching out to the Chamber’s network of members 

•	Networking to grow your business with fellow Galway Chamber members at 30+ Chamber events annually

•	Exporting advice and documentation

places.addressDisplay: The Quays, Carrick-on-Shannon, Co Leitrim ,Ireland
places.description:
Carrick-on-Shannon has grown both in population and prestige over the last number of years and is a tremendous place to live and work and holiday. Our membership comprises all major industries and service companies within the general area of the town.   
Carrick-on-Shannon Chamber is a leading business organisation; it thrives on providing a business support network and promoting the economic prosperity of Carrick-on-Shannon and its surrounding areas. It aims to act as a public voice on behalf of the business community on items of local or national interest affecting Carrick-on-Shannon.  
Tourism is a major focus for our Chamber and led us to set up the MyCarrick.ie website and marketing campaign with the aid of funding from Leitrim Development Co.  The My Carrick website has 350 listings and is free to any business within the Carrick on Shannon  area.   It is packed with  very practical up to date tourist info -letting you know where to stay, where to eat, what to do and what’s on - everything you need to know about our refreshing yet invigorating town.

South East BIC, a public private partnership, supports the generation and development of new innovative enterprises and assists existing SMEs to innovate and expand.
We provide high quality specialised business consultancy and active incubation. The BIC team works closely in collaboration with other local, regional, national enterprise support agencies and has strong international connections, particularly in Europe, through its membership of the European BIC Network (EBN).
From its Waterford base, the team works throughout the counties of Waterford, Wexford, Carlow, Kilkenny and Tipperary and focuses largely on project evaluation and development, business modelling, planning and sourcing finance.

The Small Firms Association is the national organisation exclusively representing the needs of small enterprises (i.e. those employing less than 50 employees) in Ireland.  The SFA directly meets government at the table and interacts with key decision-makers at all levels to ensure that the economic environment is conducive to small business establishment and development.  The SFA secures the best deal for small firms by providing dedicated professional support and by offering an unparalleled range of services to members, including economic, commercial, employee relations and social affairs advice and assistance.

places.description:
Limerick City & County Council is in the process of establishing a new public-private partnership company ‘Innovate Limerick Ltd’, in order to integrate the innovation activities of both the Limerick 2030 Economic Strategy (2013) and the Limerick Regeneration Framework Implementation Plan (2013) and deliver on this socio-economic innovation agenda.

These plans build on previous reports including the Mid West Task Force Report (2009) and the Forfás Mid West Regional Competitiveness Agenda (2010), which argue that Limerick's innovation ecosystem should be more open and collaborative to help transition Limerick to a high value added economy.

The new company will seek to accelerate innovation in Limerick by providing a supportive environment that will facilitate and encourage higher levels of innovation across the various stakeholders and sectors in Limerick.

places.description:
The Enterprise Europe Network is the world’s largest support network for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) and helps ambitious Irish companies to make the most of business and technology opportunities in the EU and other major global markets.   With close to 600 member organisations in over 54 countries, they include development agencies, chambers of commerce, technology centres and universities.

The Network can help develop your business in new markets, source or license new technologies, business opportunities from our live database, partners searches for EU funded R&D, advice on EU legislation, business advice on new markets and comprehensive innovation support.  

Contact your local network advisor in your region:
The Enterprise Europe Network is supported in Ireland by Enterprise Ireland, Local Enterprise Offices and Dublin & Cork Chambers of Commerce.

From its Waterford base, the team works throughout the counties of Waterford, Wexford, Carlow, Kilkenny and Tipperary and focuses largely on project evaluation and development, business modelling, planning and sourcing finance.

The Irish Engineering Enterprises Federation promotes and supports the competitiveness and growth of the engineering sector in Ireland.  Engineering is a diverse sector with a wide range of indigenous and multinational companies.  The IEEF represents mechanical and electrical engineering companies which are involved in manufacturing or services. It provides business and market information to companies and develops specific programmes on key business issues.

places.description:
The Irish Film Industry is booming.  According to the latest survey carried out by PWC (one of the leading global providers of company research & investing information)  in 2008, the Irish audio-visual sector is a key industry for growth valued at over five and a half million and employs over six thousand individuals. Its attractiveness to both local and international investors arises from a mix of high level expertise, skills and very competitive tax incentives.
Port Pictures aims to attracting both local and foreign investors and talent while simultaneously helping to increase Ireland’s international competitiveness as a location for media productions.
Port Pictures Limited plans to share its in-depth knowledge of the Irish market to intelligently develop and produce quality, innovative and intelligent content across a multitude of formats including feature films, documentaries, music videos and commercials. 
Although Port Pictures Limited was only founded in 2014, it will hugely benefit from the wealth of experience it’s founder Martina Niland brings in particular across the complex areas of finance, production and co-production, distribution and sales. Having worked in the Industry for over a decade, Martina has built an impressive network of industry professionals both here in Ireland and internationally and has co-produced features films with countries such as Canada (STAY, 2012), Germany (RUN & JUMP 2012) and Holland (MILO, 2011). To date, her most critically acclaimed production was John Carney's ONCE, which received the Oscar® for Best Original Song in 2008 and she has just completed production on John’s much anticipated new film, SING STREET, which will be released worldwide in 2016. 
Port Pictures Limited aims to nurture and develop these already existing relationships with talent, financiers, festivals, sales agencies and distributors in the years ahead.

places.description:
RAPTOR produces intelligent solutions for managing complex functions relating to process management or project management. It is based on an end to end Software as a Service (SaaS) delivery platform.
A typical use for Raptor is in the delivery of complex construction projects and coordinating the functions around an established production process.
It is an innovative Enterprise Management platform which comprises separate functions such as estimating, safety, human resources, scheduling and reporting. These functions interact intelligently producing considerable added value and knowledge giving real time insight on the status of a project or process. 
Raptor is entirely cloud based and built on scalable technology. It integrates with existing management tools and is designed to eliminate lack of clarity while empowering all stakeholders to contribute to the success of the project. 
Our unique integration of the traditionally fragmented facets of project & process management delivers a single adaptable and cost effective tool enabling lean and transparent reporting for task-based endeavors. The amalgamation of processes into a single workflow eliminates data re-entry, ingrains risk with schedule & gives accurate real time status. 
Core functionality is developed using c# .NET, SQL Server and hosted on MS Azure. Interfaces are built using the latest web and app development technologies.

SOAR enables increased productivity, current asset visibility, automated asset reconciliation and offers the potential to significantly reduce or eliminate costs associated with current auditing procedures.

places.description:
The Irish Film Industry is booming.  According to the latest survey carried out by PWC (one of the leading global providers of company research & investing information)  in 2008, the Irish audio-visual sector is a key industry for growth valued at over five and a half million and employs over six thousand individuals. Its attractiveness to both local and international investors arises from a mix of high level expertise, skills and very competitive tax incentives.
Port Pictures aims to attracting both local and foreign investors and talent while simultaneously helping to increase Ireland’s international competitiveness as a location for media productions.
Port Pictures Limited plans to share its in-depth knowledge of the Irish market to intelligently develop and produce quality, innovative and intelligent content across a multitude of formats including feature films, documentaries, music videos and commercials. 
Although Port Pictures Limited was only founded in 2014, it will hugely benefit from the wealth of experience it’s founder Martina Niland brings in particular across the complex areas of finance, production and co-production, distribution and sales. Having worked in the Industry for over a decade, Martina has built an impressive network of industry professionals both here in Ireland and internationally and has co-produced features films with countries such as Canada (STAY, 2012), Germany (RUN & JUMP 2012) and Holland (MILO, 2011). To date, her most critically acclaimed production was John Carney's ONCE, which received the Oscar® for Best Original Song in 2008 and she has just completed production on John’s much anticipated new film, SING STREET, which will be released worldwide in 2016. 
Port Pictures Limited aims to nurture and develop these already existing relationships with talent, financiers, festivals, sales agencies and distributors in the years ahead.

places.description:
RAPTOR produces intelligent solutions for managing complex functions relating to process management or project management. It is based on an end to end Software as a Service (SaaS) delivery platform.
A typical use for Raptor is in the delivery of complex construction projects and coordinating the functions around an established production process.
It is an innovative Enterprise Management platform which comprises separate functions such as estimating, safety, human resources, scheduling and reporting. These functions interact intelligently producing considerable added value and knowledge giving real time insight on the status of a project or process. 
Raptor is entirely cloud based and built on scalable technology. It integrates with existing management tools and is designed to eliminate lack of clarity while empowering all stakeholders to contribute to the success of the project. 
Our unique integration of the traditionally fragmented facets of project & process management delivers a single adaptable and cost effective tool enabling lean and transparent reporting for task-based endeavors. The amalgamation of processes into a single workflow eliminates data re-entry, ingrains risk with schedule & gives accurate real time status. 
Core functionality is developed using c# .NET, SQL Server and hosted on MS Azure. Interfaces are built using the latest web and app development technologies.

places.description: Risk Management Technology for funded Inventory. Our Platform eliminates collateral risk.

Creators of SOAR, a secure cloud based Platform combined with a smartphone app and anti tamper proof NFC* tags that allows clients to “talk to, and see assets” under their control including their GPS location in real-time.   
It is a risk and inventory management Application that harnesses advances in technology to deliver audit process efficiencies with verifiable accuracy.  SOAR enables increased productivity, current asset visibility, automated asset reconciliation and offers the potential to significantly reduce or eliminate costs associated with current auditing procedures.
The Platform, the technology and architecture behind it has been built to provide a wide variety of additional commercial functions (modules) allowing economy of scale solutions as opposed to standalone more costly investments.  These include, communications, compliance, fleet, vehicle inspection, anti-counterfeiting, digital certification, residual value augmentation, telematics and vitally the business intelligence to be leveraged from these applications.

places.description:
The Irish Film Industry is booming.  According to the latest survey carried out by PWC (one of the leading global providers of company research & investing information)  in 2008, the Irish audio-visual sector is a key industry for growth valued at over five and a half million and employs over six thousand individuals. Its attractiveness to both local and international investors arises from a mix of high level expertise, skills and very competitive tax incentives.
Port Pictures aims to attracting both local and foreign investors and talent while simultaneously helping to increase Ireland’s international competitiveness as a location for media productions.
Port Pictures Limited plans to share its in-depth knowledge of the Irish market to intelligently develop and produce quality, innovative and intelligent content across a multitude of formats including feature films, documentaries, music videos and commercials. 
Although Port Pictures Limited was only founded in 2014, it will hugely benefit from the wealth of experience it’s founder Martina Niland brings in particular across the complex areas of finance, production and co-production, distribution and sales. Having worked in the Industry for over a decade, Martina has built an impressive network of industry professionals both here in Ireland and internationally and has co-produced features films with countries such as Canada (STAY, 2012), Germany (RUN & JUMP 2012) and Holland (MILO, 2011). To date, her most critically acclaimed production was John Carney's ONCE, which received the Oscar® for Best Original Song in 2008 and she has just completed production on John’s much anticipated new film, SING STREET, which will be released worldwide in 2016. 
Port Pictures Limited aims to nurture and develop these already existing relationships with talent, financiers, festivals, sales agencies and distributors in the years ahead.

Creators of SOAR, a secure cloud based Platform combined with a smartphone app and anti tamper proof NFC* tags that allows clients to “talk to, and see assets” under their control including their GPS location in real-time.   
It is a risk and inventory management Application that harnesses advances in technology to deliver audit process efficiencies with verifiable accuracy.  SOAR enables increased productivity, current asset visibility, automated asset reconciliation and offers the potential to significantly reduce or eliminate costs associated with current auditing procedures.
The Platform, the technology and architecture behind it has been built to provide a wide variety of additional commercial functions (modules) allowing economy of scale solutions as opposed to standalone more costly investments. Food, beverage and ingredient label compliance analysis,

Food product development and innovation support,

Scientific and regulation literature reviews,
Competitive landscape analysis for health claims,

Clean label ingredient substitution and sourcing support,

Feasibility studies for new product development.

places.description: Digital Story tellers and Social Media Managers

The Irish Film Industry is booming.  According to the latest survey carried out by PWC (one of the leading global providers of company research & investing information)  in 2008, the Irish audio-visual sector is a key industry for growth valued at over five and a half million and employs over six thousand individuals. Its attractiveness to both local and international investors arises from a mix of high level expertise, skills and very competitive tax incentives.
Port Pictures aims to attracting both local and foreign investors and talent while simultaneously helping to increase Ireland’s international competitiveness as a location for media productions.
Port Pictures Limited plans to share its in-depth knowledge of the Irish market to intelligently develop and produce quality, innovative and intelligent content across a multitude of formats including feature films, documentaries, music videos and commercials. 
Although Port Pictures Limited was only founded in 2014, it will hugely benefit from the wealth of experience it’s founder Martina Niland brings in particular across the complex areas of finance, production and co-production, distribution and sales. Having worked in the Industry for over a decade, Martina has built an impressive network of industry professionals both here in Ireland and internationally and has co-produced features films with countries such as Canada (STAY, 2012), Germany (RUN & JUMP 2012) and Holland (MILO, 2011). To date, her most critically acclaimed production was John Carney's ONCE, which received the Oscar® for Best Original Song in 2008 and she has just completed production on John’s much anticipated new film, SING STREET, which will be released worldwide in 2016. 
Port Pictures Limited aims to nurture and develop these already existing relationships with talent, financiers, festivals, sales agencies and distributors in the years ahead.

GKIC Ireland has two aims:
1.	Provide entrepreneurs with the place, environment where they can take time out to think about their business, share ideas, learn from each other, build connections and grow.
2.	Show them how to stop wasting money, time and effort on marketing and advertising that doesn't work and start using GKIC style direct response marketing to get more customers, make money and have more freedom.
The six key elements to GKIC Ireland are:
•	Accountability
•	Learning
•	Sharing
•	Projects for Growth
•	Networking
•	Fun

places.description:
The GEC is an entrepreneurial community unmatched anywhere else in Ireland. We are a community of entrepreneurs, working in a dynamic environment specifically geared towards supporting ambitious, growth orientated companies. 
 
As well as the founders and employees of over 150 companies, you will find investors, mentors, business advisors and influencers, industry representatives and government support agents walking the corridors of the GEC. 
 
We also have large, bright contemporary office space along with access to accelerator programmes, professional networking events, social activities and training courses.
 
Contact us today for a tour! (info@gec.ie)

places.description: Startup Galway subgroup that convenes on last Friday of every month in Galway. The idea is to select two startup businesses for each meetup who want to practice a pitch for a specific purpose. Informal mentoring on the pitch  can be provided in advance if required - join the Meetup Group to find out more.

GKIC Ireland has two aims:
1.	Provide entrepreneurs with the place, environment where they can take time out to think about their business, share ideas, learn from each other, build connections and grow.
2.	Show them how to stop wasting money, time and effort on marketing and advertising that doesn't work and start using GKIC style direct response marketing to get more customers, make money and have more freedom.
The six key elements to GKIC Ireland are:
•	Accountability
•	Learning
•	Sharing
•	Projects for Growth
•	Networking
•	Fun

The Green Way was established in 2010 as Dublin’s cleantech cluster, to stimulate economic growth and employment in the green economy. The Green Way is a collaborative cluster, recognised by government as a convergence of knowledge, expertise and experience which is stimulating transformational change for the Irish cleantech sector through deployment of best practice clean technology solutions.

places.description:
South East BIC, a public private partnership, supports the generation and development of new innovative enterprises and assists existing SMEs to innovate and expand.
We provide high quality specialised business consultancy and active incubation. The BIC team works closely in collaboration with other local, regional, national enterprise support agencies and has strong international connections, particularly in Europe, through its membership of the European BIC Network (EBN).
From its Waterford base, the team works throughout the counties of Waterford, Wexford, Carlow, Kilkenny and Tipperary and focuses largely on project evaluation and development, business modelling, planning and sourcing finance.

places.description:
South East BIC, a public private partnership, supports the generation and development of new innovative enterprises and assists existing SMEs to innovate and expand.
We provide high quality specialised business consultancy and active incubation. The BIC team works closely in collaboration with other local, regional, national enterprise support agencies and has strong international connections, particularly in Europe, through its membership of the European BIC Network (EBN).
From its Waterford base, the team works throughout the counties of Waterford, Wexford, Carlow, Kilkenny and Tipperary and focuses largely on project evaluation and development, business modelling, planning and sourcing finance.

places.description:
The GEC is an entrepreneurial community unmatched anywhere else in Ireland. We are a community of entrepreneurs, working in a dynamic environment specifically geared towards supporting ambitious, growth orientated companies. 
 
As well as the founders and employees of over 150 companies, you will find investors, mentors, business advisors and influencers, industry representatives and government support agents walking the corridors of the GEC. 
 
We also have large, bright contemporary office space along with access to accelerator programmes, professional networking events, social activities and training courses.
 
Contact us today for a tour! (info@gec.ie)

places.description:
The Ludgate Hub is currently in the final stages of modification, reusing an old bakery building that was formally a cinema the building has now come full circle into the digital age. This impressive 10,000 square foot building will host up to 75 desks, training and meeting room spaces, a state of the art telepresence suite, and canteen and break out facilities.

The Ludgate Hub will be home to 1000MB of uncontested internet connection suitable for all types of digitally enabled businesses.

Established with a mission to support industry and academia in driving research to market, Tyndall National Institute is one of Europe’s leading research centres in Information and Communications Technology (ICT) research and development and the largest research facility of its type in Ireland. Established in 2004 as a successor to the National Microelectronics Research Centre (NMRC founded in 1982) at University College Cork, the Institute hosts over 460 researchers, engineers and support staff, including a full-time postgraduate cohort of 135 students, generating over 200 peer-reviewed publications each year.

places.description:
SFI-funded IPIC brings together more than 100 researchers from four institutes to develop new light-enabled technologies. Photonics is the generation, manipulation and use of light. It is a key enabling technology that underpins the internet and affects diverse industries such as medical devices, renewable energy, manufacturing and environmental monitoring.

Academic partners: Tyndall National Institute, Cork Institute of Technology, Dublin City University, University College Cork

Industry partners: British Telecom, Compact Imaging Ltd, Eblana, Epi-light Ltd, FazTech, Firecomms, InfiniLED, Intel, Lake Region Medical, Luxcel Biosciences, M/A-COM, Pilot Photonics, Radisens Diagnostics, Seagate, Somex, Stryker, X-Celeprint, Xilinx

SFI-funded Insight is one of the biggest data analytics centres in Europe. It undertakes high-impact research, seeks to derive value from Big Data and provides innovative technology solutions for industry and society by enabling better decision-making. It is based in UCD, DCU, NUIG and UCC.

CTVR has evolved and is now incorporated into CONNECT.

places.description:
BDI is a Science Foundation Ireland CSET (Centre for Science, Engineering and Technology). Established in October 2005, the BDI is an Academic-Business-Clinical partnership that carries out cutting-edge research programmes focused on the development of next-generation biomedical diagnostic devices. The BDI vision is to transform healthcare by pioneering advances in the science and technology of diagnostics and by translating these advances into clinical use.
BDI research addresses major clinical challenges informed by the partnership of clinicians, scientists and industry. Building on key scientific insights, the BDI will now apply its established capabilities to create integrated Point-of-Care solutions, which will have major impacts on diagnosing disease and sustaining human health.

places.description:
The SFI-funded APC Microbiome Institute is a gastrointestinal health research centre exploring the role that gastrointestinal bacteria (microbiota) play in health and disease. The microbiota is a target for treatment and prevention of disease, and a source of functional food ingredients, new drugs and disease biomarkers.

SFI-funded IPIC brings together more than 100 researchers from four institutes to develop new light-enabled technologies. Photonics is the generation, manipulation and use of light. places.description:
SEAM (South Eastern Applied Materials) is a research and development facility based in Waterford Institute of Technology, providing innovative materials engineering solutions for research and industrial partners from wide ranging sectors.

Services include;
•	X-Ray Micro-Tomography (CT)
•	Finite Element Analysis and Design Optimisation
•	Failure Analysis
•	Material Characterisation
•	3D Metal Additive Manufacturing

SEAM is one of Ireland’s leading Technology Gateway Centres. Seed funded by Enterprise Ireland, it facilitates the development of technology solutions through collaboration and access to expertise in the Irish research infrastructure. SEAM provides innovative materials engineering solutions for industries from wide ranging sectors such as Biomedical, Pharma, Precision Engineering, Energy and Electronics. SEAM’s unique strength lies in its ability to anticipate, understand, respond quickly and professionally to industry needs through provision of competitive customised solutions and more importantly, act as a one-stop-shop for getting the job done. SEAM have a proven track record of delivering for industry, having executed over 800 direct funded industry projects spanning across over 100 companies since its launch in 2009.  Notable SEAM repeat clients include Teva, Bausch and Lomb, Schivo, Honeywell,  Stryker, Genzyme, Lake region medical, Valeo and Boston Scientific.

SEAM provides a wide range of complete solution services to industry including; Failure Analysis, Metrology Analysis, Material Characterisation, Contaminant Identification/Analysis and Mechanical Property Analysis.  The types of services that SEAM offer to industries include direct funded short and medium term bespoke projects and strategic long term research partnership projects to solve specific technical challenges for SMEs, large Irish companies and multinationals. SEAM also helps industries to source funding opportunities and helps companies to develop and commercialise tec

SEAM (South Eastern Applied Materials) is a research and development facility based in Waterford Institute of Technology, providing innovative materials engineering solutions for research and industrial partners from wide ranging sectors.

Services include;
•	X-Ray Micro-Tomography (CT)
•	Finite Element Analysis and Design Optimisation
•	Failure Analysis
•	Material Characterisation
•	3D Metal Additive Manufacturing

SEAM is one of Ireland’s leading Technology Gateway Centres. Seed funded by Enterprise Ireland, it facilitates the development of technology solutions through collaboration and access to expertise in the Irish research infrastructure. SEAM provides innovative materials engineering solutions for industries from wide ranging sectors such as Biomedical, Pharma, Precision Engineering, Energy and Electronics. SEAM’s unique strength lies in its ability to anticipate, understand, respond quickly and professionally to industry needs through provision of competitive customised solutions and more importantly, act as a one-stop-shop for getting the job done. SEAM have a proven track record of delivering for industry, having executed over 800 direct funded industry projects spanning across over 100 companies since its launch in 2009.  Notable SEAM repeat clients include Teva, Bausch and Lomb, Schivo, Honeywell,  Stryker, Genzyme, Lake region medical, Valeo and Boston Scientific.

SEAM provides a wide range of complete solution services to industry including; Failure Analysis, Metrology Analysis, Material Characterisation, Contaminant Identification/Analysis and Mechanical Property Analysis.  The types of services that SEAM offer to industries include direct funded short and medium term bespoke projects and strategic long term research partnership projects to solve specific technical challenges for SMEs, large Irish companies and multinationals. SEAM also helps industries to source funding opportunities and helps companies to develop and commercialise tec

places.description: Established with a mission to support industry and academia in driving research to market, Tyndall National Institute is one of Europe’s leading research centres in Information and Communications Technology (ICT) research and development and the largest research facility of its type in Ireland. Established in 2004 as a successor to the National Microelectronics Research Centre (NMRC founded in 1982) at University College Cork, the Institute hosts over 460 researchers, engineers and support staff, including a full-time postgraduate cohort of 135 students, generating over 200 peer-reviewed publications each year.

places.description:
The Digital Hub is a vibrant, collaborative community for business growth, networking & creativity. 

Based in the historic Liberties area of Dublin city centre, The Digital Hub is an enterprise cluster for growing technology companies.  Home to established and early-stage businesses, 
The Digital Hub is the largest cluster of digital media, technology and Internet businesses in Ireland, providing a space for indigenous enterprises scale and grow. Global companies and industry organisations also have offices at The Digital Hub.

Since 2003 hundreds of companies have progressed through the enterprise cluster at The Digital Hub generating thousands of skilled jobs.

Full a list of all buildings at The Digital Hub campus see: http://www.thedigitalhub.com/contact/31#map

places.description:
As a University of Enterprise, DCU is renowned for its market facing approach and focus on collaborating with industry to provide innovative solutions across many sectors. With a real understanding of industry roadmaps and landscapes, the DCU approach is to work with companies to define their problem statement, devise creative solutions and implement these ideas into practice. DCU has worked with many large organisations to enhance their R&D capabilities and also with emerging companies who are focused on innovation to improve competitiveness. A thriving enterprise culture at DCU has seen new companies incubate and develop at Invent, DCU’s Innovation & Enterprise Centre and many established organisations have leveraged the universities expertise and infrastructure whilst based at DCU’s state-of-the-art Innovation Campus. Depending on your company’s stage in its lifecycle, DCU has various modes of engagement to suit. 
To see how DCU can help your company to innovate talk to us at:
Phone: 00 353 1 700 6188
Email: richard.stokes @invent.dcu.ie
Web: www.dcu.ie/invent
We would be delighted to hear from you!

places.description:
As a University of Enterprise, DCU is renowned for its market facing approach and focus on collaborating with industry to provide innovative solutions across many sectors. With a real understanding of industry roadmaps and landscapes, the DCU approach is to work with companies to define their problem statement, devise creative solutions and implement these ideas into practice. DCU has worked with many large organisations to enhance their R&D capabilities and also with emerging companies who are focused on innovation to improve competitiveness. A thriving enterprise culture at DCU has seen new companies incubate and develop at Invent, DCU’s Innovation & Enterprise Centre and many established organisations have leveraged the universities expertise and infrastructure whilst based at DCU’s state-of-the-art Innovation Campus. Depending on your company’s stage in its lifecycle, DCU has various modes of engagement to suit. 
To see how DCU can help your company to innovate talk to us at:
Phone: 00 353 1 700 6188

Company Registration is an independent company formation agency. We want to give you personal advice on forming companies in Ireland along with providing you with a professional and expert service in company secretarial, accountancy, tax, audit and business advisory.
We are a 100% Irish owned and managed company, physically located in Limerick and Cork. Thanks to our friendly and professional approach, we have forged strong business relationships with our clients learning to understand their real needs in order to help them achieve their goals. That is the reason why you can trust us to give you the best of advice.
We have simplified our forms so you can save time filling them out, registering business names and administering your required secretarial process.
Our price policy is to give MORE, for LESS. We offer a number of set packages to suit a variety of start up budgets, but if you prefer, we can also provide a custom package with just the services you really require.
Moreover, we are associated with a number of solicitors firms who provide full commercial and business legal assistance in various parts of Ireland.

Wisetek’s recycling priority is the recovery of material, either for reuse within our client's operations or for remarketing to our global network of buyers under the Wisetekmarket.com site. places.description:
Wisetek is a global provider of Secure Data-Elimination & Responsible IT Recycling Services to the world’s leading IT Corporations. Wisetek operate from our bases located in Ireland, the USA and Thailand. Our list of clients includes EMC, VCE, McAfee and large data center services companies. 

Wisetek’s recycling priority is the recovery of material, either for reuse within our client's operations or for remarketing to our global network of buyers under the Wisetekmarket.com site. These reuse priorities assure our clients that they receive optimal financial pay-back from the flow of used assets.

Company Registration is an independent company formation agency. We want to give you personal advice on forming companies in Ireland along with providing you with a professional and expert service in company secretarial, accountancy, tax, audit and business advisory.
We are a 100% Irish owned and managed company, physically located in Limerick and Cork. Thanks to our friendly and professional approach, we have forged strong business relationships with our clients learning to understand their real needs in order to help them achieve their goals. That is the reason why you can trust us to give you the best of advice.
We have simplified our forms so you can save time filling them out, registering business names and administering your required secretarial process.
